business.headline: SIPs in crypto? What they are and how to get startedCrypto is often linked with sharp price swings and high risk. SIPs, on the other hand, are associated with steady, long-term investing. So what happens when these two very different ideas come together? That is where the conversation around crypto SIPs begins.

Exclusive: AI is like a tsunami hitting jobs market, warns IMF's chiefAccording to Georgieva, AI can boost growth and raise incomes. However, if not handled carefully, it can deepen inequality and unsettle workers.

Sensex ends over 300 points higher, Nifty gains despite market volatilityThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 316.57 points to end at 82,814.71, while the Nifty50 gained 116.90 points to settle at 25,571.25. Broader market indices also recovered well through the afternoon, lifting overall sentiment.

Gold jumps nearly Rs 1,000, silver surges Rs 4,000: Time to invest or wait for a dip?After several weeks of uncertainty, gold and silver are now moving higher with steady gains. This has boosted market sentiment, but it has also left many wondering whether to buy now or wait for more favourable prices.

How Hyderabad's love for biryani exposed a nationwide multi-crore tax scamIn India, biryani is more than food. It is an emotion that finally left a trail too big to hide. Read on to find out how it exposed a nationwide multi-crore tax scam.

8th Pay Commission: When will you get your arrears and salary hike?Central government employees and pensioners are closely watching every update on the 8th Pay Commission. The big questions remain, i.e., when will the new pay structure be implemented, and when will arrears actually reach your bank account?

IMF chief says India well-positioned in AI race thanks to digital infrastructureAccording to Kristalina Georgieva, India is in a strong position due to its early investment in digital public infrastructure, which now forms the base for wider AI access.

How a biryani billing trail exposed tax scam; Rs 70,000 crore sales hiddenWhat began as a simple I-T review of biryani restaurant bills turned into a sweeping hunt for Rs 70,000 crore in suppressed sales buried across the country.

Why has this Dutch company's stock gained over 90% on Nasdaq in six months?ASML Holding's stock has gained 94.66% in the past six months on the US stock exchange Nasdaq, where many of the world's biggest technology companies list their shares.

Infosys, Tech Mahindra, TCS: Why IT stocks are falling again todayThe slide in IT stocks raises fresh questions about what is spooking investors and how long this uneasy phase could last. A closer look may reveal more than the morning numbers suggest.

Sensex, Nifty open flat amid volatility, IT stocks continue to declineWith global cues expected to remain volatile, investors are likely to stay cautious. Movements in crude oil, the rupee and developments in the US–Iran standoff will remain key drivers for market direction through the day.

UK and India must shape AI together, says Kanishka NarayanIn an exclusive conversation with India Today, UK AI Minister Kanishka Narayan highlighted the strengthening technological partnership between India and the United Kingdom.

BNW Developments partners with Radisson Hotel Group for hotel and residencesThe development will include the Radisson Blu Hotel, RAK Central, with 361 rooms, and Radisson Blu Residences, RAK Central, with 222 branded homes.

Sensex closes 1,236 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; IndiGo down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 1,236.11 points to close at 82,498.14, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 365 points to end at 25,454.35.
Sensex down 1,200 points: 3 reasons why the stock market is falling todayAt the closing bell, the Sensex was down 1236.11 points at 82,498.14, while the Nifty50 had slipped 365 points to 25,454.35.

Investing in IPOs? Your money may be funding the promoter, not the companyAccording to a detailed study by 1 Finance Magazine, which analysed more than 1,700 IPOs between 2015 and 2025, 63% of total IPO proceeds now come from Offer for Sale. Only 37% is fresh capital raised for business growth.

Infosys down 18% in a month, TCS falls 14%: Is it an opportunity to buy IT stocks?IT stocks have corrected sharply, but is this panic justified? Before you decide to sell or buy the dip, here's what the AI shift and global slowdown really mean for investors.

SpiceJet signs MoU for 10 aircraft, targets major capacity ramp-upThe development comes just days after the board approved a calibrated fleet ramp-up to 60 aircraft through a mix of wet and damp leases, along with the phased return of previously grounded planes.

Gold, silver prices drop sharply. Are they still a safe bet for investors?Gold and silver prices have dipped, but does that mean the rally is over? Experts explain what the recent correction really signals and why many investors still see strength ahead.

entertainment.headline: Patrick Dempsey reflects on Grey's Anatomy co-star Eric Dane's final days Actor Patrick Dempsey has shared an emotional tribute to Eric Dane following his death at 53, recalling their final conversations and the laughter they shared.

The Night Agent 3 review: Suraj Sharma joins Gabriel Basso for an edgier seasonRelease Date:Fri Feb 20, 2026 The Night Agent Season 3 on Netflix raised the bar with a gripping blend of global conspiracies and moral complexity, making the story more intense and relatable. Featuring strong performances, especially by Indian actor Suraj Sharma, the season delivered a fresh, layered thriller experience for loyal fans.

Karan Patel suffered rib fracture, quit The 50 on medical advice: Actor's team Actor Karan Patel's team released a statement following his departure from The 50. It explained the circumstances around his exit and addressed narratives regarding his performance and conduct during the show.

It's gonna get crazy: Rishab Shetty reacts to Yash's Toxic teaser The highly anticipated teaser for Toxic: A Fairytale for Grown-Ups has been released, showcasing Yash's striking transformation. The film is set for a major box office clash this March.

Second Case of Seetharam review: Vijay Raghavendra anchors engaging slow burnRelease Date:Fri Feb 20, 2026 Second Case of Seetharam movie review: The Vijay Raghavendra-starrer sequel offers a slow-burn investigation with strong psychological elements but faces pacing challenges.

Mahesh Babu's Lord Ram look from Varanasi out? Theatre hoarding goes viral Mahesh Babu's Lord Ram look from the film Varanasi has surfaced on a digital theatre hoarding in Guntur. The viral poster hints at the actor's intense preparation and the film's epic narrative under SS Rajamouli's direction.

Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah marks Shivarajkumar's 40 years in cinema: Truly no equal Karnataka's Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and others celebrate Shivarajkumar's four decades as a lead actor, highlighting his film achievements and recent return to work after health challenges.

Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone step out amid extortion threat. Pics go viral Actor-couple Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone made a public appearance in Mumbai to support her father, Prakash Padukone. The outing came amid increasing security around their home after a threatening extortion message to the Dhurandhar star.

Supreme Court pulls up Elvish Yadav in snake venom case, flags Wildlife Act breach The Supreme Court pulled up Elvish Yadav while hearing his plea in the alleged snake venom case, saying it would send a "bad message" if protected species were misused. The bench said it would examine the complaint under the Wildlife (Protection) Act.

Anurag Kashyap's Bandar with Bobby Deol set for theatrical release. Check out date Anurag Kashyap's film Bandar starring Bobby Deol is set for worldwide theatrical release in May 2026. The film's premiere at the Toronto Film Festival has raised expectations about its socio-political themes.

Grey's Anatomy star Eric Dane was in high spirits at the hospital before death Eric Dane, known for his roles in Grey's Anatomy and Euphoria, has died at the age of 53 following a battle with ALS, prompting widespread tributes from fans.

Grey's Anatomy cast pay tribute to Eric Dane after his death: He was a light The cast and creators of Grey's Anatomy have paid heartfelt tribute to Eric Dane. His remarkable talent and warm presence left an indelible mark on fans and colleagues alike across India and beyond.

BTS' V taken aback after Min Hee-jin submits private messages as court evidence BTS member V has responded after private messages with Min Hee-jin were used as evidence in a HYBE legal dispute. The controversy highlights tensions over plagiarism claims and corporate conflicts within HYBE.

Never wanted to leave: Priyanka Chopra on being 'pushed' to work outside Bollywood Priyanka Chopra reveals feeling limited in Bollywood, explains her move to Hollywood, and shares thoughts on balancing her work between Indian and international films, as well as her experiences with her latest projects.

The many lives of Eric Dane: How he rewrote the script, one risky role at a time Eric Dane, known for his performances in Grey's Anatomy and Euphoria, has died aged 53 after battling ALS. His career evolved from charming television star to a complex character actor, leaving a significant mark on audiences and colleagues.

Do Deewane Seher Mein review: A tender tale of imperfect loveRelease Date:Fri Feb 20, 2026 Do Deewane Seher Mein movie review: Do Deewane Seher Mein explores a love story rooted in imperfections and emotional scars. The film highlights how childhood wounds influence adult relationships and healing.

Toxic teaser review: Yash's splendid dual act and the KGF-Marco hangover Yash's Toxic teaser showcases his dual roles in a stylish gangster drama set in Goa. The film promises intense violence and a fresh female perspective, raising expectations ahead of its March release.

Priyanka Chopra: Don't build your life on bluffing other people | Exclusive  Priyanka Chopra Jonas stars in and co-produces The Bluff, a film about courage and motherhood. In an interview with India Today, she talked about fame, motherhood and excessive PR in the film industry.

Big fan of Dhanush: Mrunal Thakur sets record straight on romance rumours Actor Mrunal Thakur dismissed ongoing speculation about her relationship with Dhanush, saying she is simply a fan of the actor and wishes to collaborate with him in the future.

general news.headline: Hardly any other option: Supreme Court puts Bengal SIR under judicial oversightThe Supreme Court has directed the appointment of either serving or former additional district judges as judicial officers to oversee the ongoing Bengal SIR procedure, citing a "trust deficit" between the state government and the Election Commission of India.

Typos to Trump sidelining him: Pakistan PM's 'summit of humiliation'At Donald Trump's first Gaza Board of Peace meeting, Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif was isolated and sidelined, cutting a lonely figure at the event where Islamabad sought to project its so-called global relevance. Is there a silent friction between Trump and Pakistan?

How Iran-linked oil tanker seized by India went dark after entering Pak's sea zoneMT Asphalt Star, one of the three Iran-linked tankers seized near Mumbai, was detected operating suspiciously in Pakistan's Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ). On January 28, the tanker went completely "dark" for about 11 hours, disabling its Automatic Identification System, Very High Frequency radio and onboard sensors, while concealing its identity.

Why India has joined US-led Pax Silica but not Trump's Board of PeaceIndia has taken two divergent approaches to two President Donald Trump-led initiatives. While it joined Pax Silica, it sent an observer to the Board of Peace meeting. Here's why New Delhi's stance is about calibration, and not contradiction.

Fifty years of blunders: How the ICC keeps getting the World Cup format wrongFor over five decades, the ICC has repeatedly reshaped World Cup formats in the name of innovation, often sacrificing clarity and competitive integrity. From Super Six confusion to modern pre-seeding chaos, cricket's biggest tournament keeps solving problems it creates.

Youth Congress members detained at AI Summit after shirtless protest  against PMDelhi saw a bold shirtless protest by Youth Congress workers against PM Narendra Modi during the AI Summit. Authorities have initiated strict legal action as political tensions escalate in the capital.

Communal unrest grips 3 states: What happened in MP, Karnataka, AndhraCommunal tensions flared up across three states in quick succession during different religious events on Thursday. A Durga temple complex was allegedly vandalised in Jabalpur, leading to a flare-up, while stone-pelting was reported in Karnataka and Hyderabad during Shivaji Jayanti processions.

England must stop IPL owners from blocking Pak players' signings in Hundred: VaughanFormer England captain Michael Vaughan called for ECB's intervention to stop IPL-owned franchises in The Hundred from picking Pakistan players for the upcoming auction.

Do Deewane Seher Mein review: A tender tale of imperfect loveRelease Date:Fri Feb 20, 2026Do Deewane Seher Mein movie review: Do Deewane Seher Mein explores a love story rooted in imperfections and emotional scars. The film highlights how childhood wounds influence adult relationships and healing.

India, Hasina's party, BNP colluded to defeat Jamaat bloc, NCP claimsAfter a dismal performance in the recent Bangladesh election, Nahid Islam, NCP convenor and anti-Sheikh Hasina protest leader, has resorted to allegations as if to justify the party's poor show. Nahid claimed that the election results had been manipulated, and the victorious BNP colluded with India and Hasina's Awami League.

Google data centre's 6-billion-gallon thirst, and why recycled water won't workData centres are consuming billions of gallons of fresh water to keep AI servers cool. This rising demand poses a significant threat to local water supplies in drought-prone regions.

After 11,000 layoffs, Accenture says use AI at work or else no appraisal for youAccenture has reportedly informed senior employees that their promotions will now be linked to AI usage. This comes at a time when Microsoft, Google and Meta have given similar notifications as the industry shifts focus to an AI-driven future.

In an era of ring-shy men, Nick Jonas' mangalsutra bracelet is more than fashionIn a world where some men 'forget' their wedding rings at home, Nick Jonas' mangalsutra bracelet is a loud-yet-subtle declaration of love and commitment.

The assassin, the King, the legend: The biography of Imran Khan, cricket's Greek GodHandcrafted ByOur Editors Fourteen cricket legends, including Sunil Gavaskar and Kapil Dev, made a united appeal to the Pakistani government for fair and humane treatment of a jailed Imran Khan. Notably, no Pakistani cricketer was among them. So, Gen Z and Gen Alpha, listen up: long before the politics and the prison cell, Imran Khan was the ultimate main character on the cricket field.

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 26 | Anna's CM Crown: Landmarks, Legacy & Lingering LossTamil Nadu is the graveyard of national political parties. It buried the Congress at its peak then in 1967. The BJP, also at its peak now, has been pregnant with possibilities but has failed to deliver. Never a serious player in the state before the dawn of the Modi-era, the BJP has been humbled in every election since his arrival in 2014 (2019, 2021 and 2024).

Teen critical after live-in partner assaults her in Gurugram during fight over marriage plansAccording to police, the woman, a biotechnology student at a university in Gurugram, had been living with the accused after they met in September 2025. They were reportedly discussing marriage, with talks initiated between the families.

Tata Punch EV facelift launched at Rs 9.69 lakh with claimed 355-km rangeTata Motors has launched the updated Tata Punch EV in India from Rs 9.69 lakh, introducing subtle design tweaks, a new 40kWh battery option and a claimed 355km real-world range.

Brazilian President Lula speaks to India Today mega exclusive, stay tunedBrazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, who is currently in India for a bilateral meeting with PM Modi, will speak to India Today TV. The interview will focus on trade, rare earth cooperation, and artificial intelligence.

Taliban legalises domestic violence, permits beatings till no bones brokenWomen are treated in the new penal code as being on the same level as "slaves", with provisions allowing either "slave masters" or husbands to administer discretionary punishment, including beatings, to their wives or subordinates. This aspect of the code has drawn particular alarm from rights groups.

UP wedding called off after groom's family beats up bride's pet dogA wedding in Uttar Pradesh was called off after a dispute over the groom's family beating up the bride's pet dog led to a violent clash between families.

How Ziaur Rahman created an Islamist enemy for son Tarique 50 years agoTwo events have brought Bangladesh's Constitution back into focus. The recent elections that made Tarique Rahman the Prime Minister, and the approval of the July Charter referendum, mandating fresh constitutional changes. It was Tarique's father, Ziaur Rahman, who altered the original secular framework and legalised religion-based politics. Now Bangladesh's Constitution straddles a duality.

The Kerala Story 2 row explained: The scene, the politics, the pushbackThe Kerala Story 2 has sparked fresh controversy after its trailer drew sharp criticism from Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan, who called it "false propaganda." As the film heads toward its February 27 release, the row has reignited discussions on cinema, communal representation and the line between provocation and propaganda.

How Hyderabad's love for biryani exposed a nationwide multi-crore tax scamIn India, biryani is more than food. It is an emotion that finally left a trail too big to hide. Read on to find out how it exposed a nationwide multi-crore tax scam.

Europe is betting big on India, AI Summit reveals howEuropean leaders' strong turnout at the AI Impact Summit points at a pivot towards India as a partner in AI technology. With artificial intelligence's adoption lagging in Europe, EU nations seemingly see collaboration with India as key to shaping inclusive, globally relevant AI.

sports.headline: Australia vs Oman Live Score, T20 World Cup: Australia look to salvage pride in Pallekele Australia (AUS) vs Oman (OMA) Live Score, T20 World Cup: Australia have already been knocked out of the competition, and they will be looking to salvage some pride. Oman, on the other hand, would aim to finish their campaign with a spirited performance.

Pakistan board grapples with ownership issues in two PSL franchises The Pakistan Cricket Board is facing ownership concerns involving at least two of the eight franchises in the Pakistan Super League, according to PTI. A dispute has reportedly erupted within the newly auctioned Sialkot franchise over majority ownership.

England must stop IPL owners from blocking Pak players' signings in Hundred: Vaughan Former England captain Michael Vaughan called for ECB's intervention to stop IPL-owned franchises in The Hundred from picking Pakistan players for the upcoming auction.

New Zealand's Mark Chapman ready for Pakistan's familiar spin challenge in Super 8s New Zealand middle-order batter Mark Chapman is banking on the familiarity factor to counter the mystery spinner Usman Tariq-led Pakistan bowling unit in their Group 2 Super 8 clash of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup here on Saturday.

Playing all Super 8 games in Colombo is a big advantage for New Zealand: Mark Chapman T20 World Cup 2026: Here is the full excerpt from New Zealand batter Mark Chapman ahead of their game against Pakistan in Colombo.

Radha Yadav heroics power India A Women into Rising Stars Asia Cup final vs Bangladesh Rising Stars Asia Cup: Radha Yadav put in a strong all-round performance as India A Women beat Sri Lanka A Women by five wickets on Friday, February 20 at the Terdthai Cricket Ground in Bangkok.

Premier League: Igor Tudor's Spurs test, transfer battles, and big calls Managerial sackings, loan disruption and transfer confusion have once again reshaped the Premier League narrative. From Nwaneri's stalled development to Trafford's frustration and Forest's gamble, instability continues to define English football's shifting landscape.

Does Australia not take T20 World Cup seriously? Head coach responds after shock exit T20 World Cup: Australia head coach Andrew McDonald rejected claims his team didn't prioritise the T20 World Cup after crashing out in the group stages with losses to Zimbabwe and Sri Lanka in a shock exit.

Pakistan scraps two-year ban on hockey captain Ammad Butt Pakistan overturned Ammad Butt's two-year ban, calling it illegal and unconstitutional. The dramatic reversal added to the turmoil surrounding Pakistan hockey after a chaotic Australia tour and a winless Pro League campaign.

Told to rest Babar, I was forced to resign as Pakistan selector: Mohammad Yousuf T20 World Cup: Mohammad Yousuf revealed that he was forced to resign from his role as Pakistan selector in 2024 after suggesting that Babar Azam should be dropped from T20Is. Babar has struggled for form during the T20 World Cup 2026.

T20 World Cup: Is IND vs PAK on the decline? Viewership numbers suggest otherwise T20 World Cup 2026: India vs Pakistan T20 World Cup match shatters viewership records with 163 million digital reach, the highest for any ICC T20 event, despite pre-tournament boycott drama and India's dominant 8-1 record.

Watch: Shubman Gill goes full throttle in IPL prep, leaves T20 World Cup snub behindA viral nets video showed Shubman Gill in destructive touch ahead of IPL 2026. After a tough international phase and a T20 World Cup snub, the Gujarat Titans captain appeared focused on reset, rhythm and response.

From Super Six confusion to modern pre-seeding chaos, cricket's biggest tournament keeps solving problems it creates.

The Hundred auction: Joe Root, Adil Rashid among big names to go under hammerJoe Root and Adil Rashid are among the big names who are set to go under the hammer during the first-ever Hundred auction, with all 16 franchises looking to snap up big talent before the new season.

Hardik Pandya at No.5 right or wrong? Mohammed Kaif questions India's batting orderT20 World Cup: Mohammed Kaif has questioned Hardik Pandya's promotion to No.5 despite India's unbeaten run. With the Super 8s looming, India's left-heavy batting order and tactical tweaks are back under the spotlight.

Here by chance, gave it my all: Trott bids farewell to Afghanistan cricketT20 World Cup: An emotional Jonathan Trott bid farewell to Afghanistan cricket, saying that he is proud of his players and will remain a fan of them forever. Having got the chance to be the coach by luck, Trott guided Afghanistan to the semi-final stage of the T20 World Cup 2024.

From next Yuvraj to main man: Shivam Dube owning the T20 World Cup stageT20 World Cup: After being compared to Yuvraj Singh in his early days, Shivam Dube is producing a performance like the Indian legend on the T20 World Cup stage. With improved batting and bowling skills, Dube could be the difference for India in their bid to regain their crown.

Jonathan Trott left in tears talking about Afghanistan turnaround: WatchT20 World Cup: Jonathan Trott was unable to hold back his tears in his final press conference as Afghanistan coach. Trott performed a remarkable turnaround to change Afghanistan's fortunes.

Jonathan Trott: The messiah who nurtured Afghanistan like his ownT20 World Cup 2026, AFG vs CAN: Jonathan Trott has taken Afghanistan cricket to greater heights and ended his tenure as head coach following the group match against Canada on Thursday at the MA Chidambaram Stadium.

From torn shoes to towering six: Ryan Burl's chapter in Zimbabwe's T20 World Cup taleT20 World Cup: From a viral 2021 torn-shoes post to a 103-metre six in Colombo, Ryan Burl's journey mirrors Zimbabwe's T20 World Cup revival. His all-round impact has helped power them into the Super 8s.

After Abhishek Sharma slogger remark, Amir warns India opener amid poor formT20 World Cup: After calling Abhishek Sharma a slogger, Mohammad Amir has sent a warning to the Indian opener amidst his poor run of form in the T20 World Cup. Abhishek is yet to get off the mark in the competition, scoring three consecutive ducks.

Mesut Ozil's convoy involved in road accident during Bangladesh tourA vehicle in Mesut Ozil's convoy was involved in a road accident in Cox's Bazar during his Bangladesh visit. The former Germany star was unharmed as authorities launched an investigation into the incident.

T20 World Cup: India must solve familiar off-spin question as Super 8 test loomsT20 World Cup: Defending champions India have entered the Super 8s unbeaten in the ongoing ICC tournament. On paper, they remain overwhelming title contenders. On the field, however, a quieter subplot has begun to gather weight—India's vulnerability against off-spin.

Jasprit Bumrah, Varun Chakravarthy to be the difference makers in IND vs SA: PollockT20 World Cup: Shaun Pollock believes Jasprit Bumrah and Varun Chakravarthy hold the edge for India ahead of the Super 8 clash vs South Africa. The former Proteas captain sees the duo as the real point of difference.

Shadab Khan is Mike Hesson's laadla: Ex-Pak batter slams all-rounder over India remarkFormer Pakistan batter Basit Ali hit back at Shadab Khan for the all-rounder's pointed remark about former Pakistan cricketers. Shadab's claim that none of the former Pakistan players criticising the current side had managed to beat India in a World Cup has sparked controversy.

Ibrahim Zadran dedicates POTM award to departing Afghanistan coach TrottAfghanistan opener Ibrahim Zadran capped his ICC Men's T20 World Cup campaign on a high, dedicating his Player of the Match award to outgoing head coach Jonathan Trott following an emphatic 82-run victory over Canada on Thursday.

Afghanistan give Jonathan Trott a happy farewell with dominant win vs CanadaT20 World Cup, AFG vs CAN: Afghanistan beat Canada by 82 runs at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai to finish their campaign on a positive note. The Afghans also gave their head coach, Jonathan Trott, a happy farewell.

Hundred teams co-owned by IPL franchises may not consider Pak players in auctionPakistan cricketers could miss out on contracts with franchises co-owned by Indian Premier League stakeholders in the upcoming season of The Hundred, with reports suggesting that these teams may not consider them in next month's player auction.

Australia faltered in all three facets, unfair to blame only bowlers: Andrew McDonaldT20 World Cup, AUS vs OMA: Speaking to the reporters before the match against Oman, head coach Andrew McDonald said that Australia underperformed in all three departments of the game and it would be unfair to only blame the bowlers.

Devastated Australia strive for motivation in face-saving Oman clashT20 World Cup 2026, AUS vs OMA: Andrew McDonald admitted Australia are devastated after their group-stage exit from the T20 World Cup 2026 but urged the team to reset and focus on finishing strongly against Oman.

Ranji final at Hubballi due to safety works at Chinnaswamy: Karnataka AssociationThe Karnataka State Cricket Association on Thursday confirmed that the Ranji Trophy final between Karnataka and Jammu and Kashmir will be held in Hubballi, as officials aim to fast-track ongoing safety upgrade work at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
